result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Matje was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew M Matje is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew M Matje was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.

Defendant appeared in court with Attorney Patrick Schilling. Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State. Argument by State. No objection by defense. Court granted motion to terminate Drug Court Diversion Contract. Trial branch to schedule sentencing hearing.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 4500 block of Golf Rd in the Town of Windsor, WI. 
- Defendant shall cooperate and follow all rules of the Dane County Drug Court Diversion Program.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 3:24
Defendant in court with Attorney Patrick Schilling.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty on Ct 1; Ct 2 dismissed.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Drug Diversion Program. Drug Court Diversion Contract signed.  Bail continued.  Review hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
